text: Gatekeeping is telling someone to write their ray tracer/genetic algorithm/etc in Excel. Gate opening is telling someone they shouldn't do that unless they want to make a meme.

elements.text: Gatekeeping is telling someone to write their ray tracer/genetic algorithm/etc in Excel. Gate opening is telling someone they shouldn't do that unless they want to make a meme.

text: Asking for a friend, is there a way to convert LLVM representation into Excel code?

elements.text: Asking for a friend, is there a way to convert LLVM representation into Excel code?

text: I would like to relay back the message from my friend! They said thanks and they were curious as to how hmm EDIT: any suggestions welcome on resources ;)

elements.text: I would like to relay back the message from my friend! They said thanks and they were curious as to how hmm EDIT: any suggestions welcome on resources ;)

text: Wow thats so weird to think about... Converting all of a script like SciML into LLVM, and then converting it all to Excel, then running it

elements.text: Wow thats so weird to think about... Converting all of a script like SciML into LLVM, and then converting it all to Excel, then running it

text: Your friend's asking basically how to build a compiler. It's basically a compiler.

elements.text: Your friend's asking basically how to build a compiler. It's basically a compiler.

text: I know it sounds like a tall order, but people build simple compilers as end of term projects in a compilers course all the time. Rather, the assignments are different pieces and you keep adding layers of functionality.

elements.text: I know it sounds like a tall order, but people build simple compilers as end of term projects in a compilers course all the time. Rather, the assignments are different pieces and you keep adding layers of functionality.

text: So undergrads and motivated teenagers do it all the time - still takes time and dedication.

elements.text: So undergrads and motivated teenagers do it all the time - still takes time and dedication.

text:
Interesting! I never thought about making a compiler before and never thought about how they might need to work. I started looking into it and quickly went on a rollercoaster of wow thats interesting, and wow each component/layer is pretty approachable, and then I ended with wow this is way too intense. Though I might revisit the idea for the project especially a subset of the source language. A subset seems much more approachable

edit: my friend also had similar thoughts :wink:

elements.text:

text: The best resource I've found by far (because it centers LLVM) is the Self Guided Compilers course - the prof is awesome, all lectures are online and it really builds everything up nicely

elements.text: The best resource I've found by far (because it centers LLVM) is the Self Guided Compilers course - the prof is awesome, all lectures are online and it really builds everything up nicely

text: I know it says for PhD levels, but at least knowing the names of things is useful for grokking hownpeople approach these problems.

elements.text: I know it says for PhD levels, but at least knowing the names of things is useful for grokking hownpeople approach these problems.

text: Requiring it back written entirely in Postscript on the other hand seems perfectly reasonable

elements.text: Requiring it back written entirely in Postscript on the other hand seems perfectly reasonable
